channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: TikTokがいかに米国文化に影響を与え、ハリウッド、ニュース、音楽、ショッピング、政治運動、国家安全保障などを形成してきたか（ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
New York Times:
How TikTok has influenced US culture and shaped Hollywood, news, music, shopping, political campaigns, national security, and more  —  Has there ever been an app more American seeming than TikTok, with its messy democratic creativity, exhibitionism, utter lack of limits and vast variety of hustlers?

item.title: ニューヨーク州、州内の独立系報道機関を支援する初の雇用税控除プランを可決、3年間にわたり年間3,000万ドルの控除を提供（Stephanie Kaloi/The Wrap）
item.description:
Stephanie Kaloi / The Wrap:
New York passes a first-of-its-kind employment tax credit plan to support independent news outlets in the state, offering $30M in yearly credits for three years  —  The plan aims to support independent news organizations with three years of funding  —  The New York state Legislature passed …

item.title: PE企業のBlackstoneがHipgnosisの買収に約15億ドルを提示、Hipgnosisの取締役会が同意したConcordによる今週初めの入札より約7%高い (Michael Msika/Bloomberg)
item.description:
Michael Msika / Bloomberg:
PE firm Blackstone offers ~$1.5B to purchase Hipgnosis, about 7% higher than the bid made earlier this week by Concord to which Hipgnosis' board had agreed  —  - Competition heats up for Blondie, Kaiser Chiefs catalog owner  — Hipgnosis already recommended Apollo-backed Concord's offer

item.title: プログラマティック広告で年間500万ドルを稼ぎ、2025年には年間1200万ドルに増やすことを目指す、気候変動に特化したニュースメディア「The Cool Down」を見てみよう（Clara Aberneithie/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Clara Aberneithie / Press Gazette:
A look at The Cool Down, a climate-focused news outlet that makes $5M in programmatic advertising per year and aims to increase it to $12M per year in 2025  —  The Cool Down is the fastest-growing top 50 news website in the US.  —  A US news website taking a positive approach to coverage …

item.title: トランプ陣営は、多くの場合、厳しい質問や記事の後に、何人かの記者の記者証を拒否してきた。2016年には、報道機関全体の記者証を拒否した（Charlotte Klein/Vanity Fair）
item.description:
Charlotte Klein / Vanity Fair:
The Trump campaign has denied press credentials for several reporters, often after tough questions or articles; in 2016, it denied them for entire news outlets  —  Reporters from The Washington Post, Axios, and Vanity Fair have recently been rejected, though blanket bans, à la 2016, don't appear to be happening.

item.title: トランプ氏裁判の陪審員と補欠陪審員のメディア食生活をアンケートから見てみると、18人中13人がNYTから、5人がグーグルから、2人がTikTokから情報を得ている（Charlie Smart/New York Times）。
item.description:
Charlie Smart / New York Times:
A look at the media diets of jurors and alternates in Trump's trial, based on a questionnaire; 13 of 18 get news from The NYT, 5 from Google, and 2 from TikTok  —  Prosecutors and defense lawyers tried to divine the political leanings of prospective jurors in the former president's Manhattan criminal trial …

item.title: 3億7,000万ドルのRedbox契約のために行った仕事に対して「数百万ドル」の借金があると主張するコンサルタントがChicken Soup for the Soul Entertainment社を提訴（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
A consultant sues Chicken Soup for the Soul Entertainment, alleging he is owed “several million dollars” for work he did for the company's $370M Redbox deal  —  A media consultant sued Chicken Soup for the Soul Entertainment, alleging he is owed “at least several million dollars” …

item.title: セサミ・ワークショップの作家たちが経営陣と暫定合意に達し、ストライキを辛うじて回避。35人のWGAメンバーは数日中に批准投票を行う予定（Sharon Knolle/The Wrap）
item.description:
Sharon Knolle / The Wrap:
Sesame Workshop writers reach a tentative deal with management, narrowly avoiding a strike; the 35 WGA members will vote to ratify the deal in the coming days  —  Once ratified, the writers will win protections against artificial intelligence and improvements to new media residuals

item.title: ブルックリンのジャーナリストに対する殺害予告の投稿を認めた白人至上主義グループのリーダー、ニコラス・ウェルカーに44カ月の実刑判決（Lola Fadulu/New York Times）
item.description:
Lola Fadulu / New York Times:
Nicholas Welker, leader of a white supremacist group who admitted to posting a death threat against a Brooklyn journalist, is sentenced to 44 months in prison  —  Nicholas Welker admitted posting the death threat, which was meant to to silence coverage of the extremist group he led, prosecutors said.

item.title: ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙のゲーム事業の成功により、ハースト社によるパズモ社の買収など、他の新聞社もその成功を再現しようとするが、ゲーム報道は遅れている（Nathan Grayson/Aftermath）
item.description:
Nathan Grayson / Aftermath:
The New York Times' thriving games business prompts others to try to replicate its success, such as with Hearst's acquisition of Puzzmo, but games coverage lags  —  “The ad market is terrible.  There's very real news fatigue.  There's tons of alternative sources for news that aren't even news agencies."

item.title: [スレッド】カリフォルニア・ジャーナリズム保護法は、オールデンのような大手メディアやヘッジファンドには好都合だが、リッチランド・ソースのような地元インディーズには不都合（Jay Allred/@jayallred651）
item.description:
Jay Allred / @jayallred651:
[Thread] The California Journalism Protection Act is good for big media and hedge funds like Alden, but not for indie local outlets like the Richland Source  —  Can we talk about Google and the California Journalism Protection Act for a minute? 1/

item.title: 10人以上のWAMUの現職員、元職員、契約社員へのインタビューから、DCist閉鎖に関する経営陣の矛盾した不明瞭なメッセージングが明らかになった（Andrew Beaujon/Washingtonian）
item.description:
Andrew Beaujon / Washingtonian:
Interviews with over a dozen current and former WAMU staffers and contractors show management's contradictory, unclear messaging about its closure of DCist  —  The star-crossed marriage of Washington's NPR member station and a feisty digital news publication came to an abrupt end in February.

item.title: 2022年に立ち上げられ、パブリッシャーにマイクロペイメントを提供したニュースに特化したソーシャルプラットフォーム「Post.News」が、「十分なスピード」で成長できなかったため閉鎖される（Emma Roth/The Verge）
item.description:
Emma Roth / The Verge:
Post.News, the news-focused social platform launched in 2022 that offered micropayments to publishers, is shutting down after failing to grow “fast enough”  —  Post News, a Twitter alternative that emerged in the wake of Elon Musk's takeover, is shutting down.

item.title: USAGMは、元ワシントン・ポスト紙のジャーナリスト、マイケル・アブラモウィッツ氏をVOAのディレクターに任命。
item.description:
Liam Scott / Voice of America:
The USAGM names former Washington Post journalist Michael Abramowitz as the director of VOA, overseeing 48 language services reaching ~354M people weekly  —  The U.S. Agency for Global Media on Friday named Michael Abramowitz as the new permanent director of Voice of America.

item.title: グレイドン・カーターが、自身のデジタルニュースレター「Air Mail」の延長として、書籍や雑誌などを販売する実店舗「Air Mail Newsstand」をニューヨークにオープン（Ruth La Ferla/New York Times）
item.description:
Ruth La Ferla / New York Times:
Graydon Carter opens a physical store called Air Mail Newsstand in NYC, as an extension of his digital newsletter Air Mail, selling books, magazines, and more  —  Shoe horns, lampshades and CBD-infused elixirs are among the goods Graydon Carter is selling at a new newsstand-style shop in New York.
